plugins.name: Truncate
plugins.description:
It's time to tame those strings! ✂️

Truncate provides the ability to shorten text strings from both the beginning and end—by letter and by word.

To use, simply select a text layer (or multiple), enter a truncation value, and voilà!

For best results, it's recommended to use this on text layers that use the same font style.

plugins.name: Nucleus Design Component Library

plugins.name: autosizetext
plugins.description: When triggered this plugin autosizes text to fit within its textbox. If text it too small it will grow to fit the bounds or if text it too big it will shrink to fit the bounds.This plugin has three different options to select textboxes to resize.Full Page- Resizes all textboxes on current pageSelection - Resizes currently selected textboxesTextbox Names - comma seperated list of textbox names to resize (ex. textbox1,textbox2 with resize textboxes that have names textbox1 and textbox2)Visit github for more information on how to use the plugin, how to report issues, and how to suggest further improvements.

plugins.name: Prototype Quick Link
plugins.description: This is a plugin that provides an easy way to copy a Prototype link to specific frames to the clipboard without having to switch to the Presentation mode.How To UseSelect layers and run the 'Copy prototype link' command, and the link will be copied to the clipboard. You can also select and copy links to multiple selected Frames. In this case, each link will start with the name of its Frame.Demo Videolink to the file (gif)First SetupThe plugin must know the File Key to be able to create a prototype link. But this Key is private and it is only accessible to plugins published internally to a company that is on an Organization plan. So to make the plugin work you need to insert this File Key manually on first start of the plugin.Set the File KeyClick the 'Share' button on the top panel and click the 'Copy link'. Or you also can copy the whole File URL from the browser's address bar. The File URL looks like: https://figma.com/file/e9z7p5lisUPmRe9z7p5lisUPm/FileNameGo to: Plugins -> Prototype Quick Link -> SettingsPaste the copied URL to the input field and the plugin will extract the File Key automatically. You also can paste only the File Key to the input field.Done! Click 'Save' and use the pluginInfo: Your file share link is not sent to any external server.SupportPlugin creation fueled by coffee — buy me a cuppa.

accepted.name: Max Martynov
accepted.description: Web & Mobile Developer (JavaScript / Vue / Flutter / Ionic / Node)

plugins.tagline: Copy a Prototype link without switching to the Presentation mode

plugins.name: Japanese Dummy Text
plugins.description: 日本語のダミーテキストを生成します。ダミーテキストを生成したいテキストレイヤーをすべて選択し「生成」をクリックすると、レイヤーごとにダミーテキストを生成します。Min/Max のどちらかのみを入力すると、正確な文字 (文) 数を生成します。Min/Max に異なる数値を入力すると、その範囲内の文字 (文) 数を生成します。「自動生成」は、選択したレイヤーのテキストボックスに最適な量のダミーテキストで自動的に生成します。----Generate Japanese dummy text to fill your text layers.Select all the text layers you want to generate dummy text for then click "Generate" — it will generate for each layer uniquely. If you only input a number to either Min or Max, it will generate the exact number of characters or sentences. If you input different numbers to Min/Max, it will generate the number of characters or sentences in that range."Auto-generate" will automatically fill the selected layers with the perfectly amount of dummy text to fit the text box.

plugins.name: Variables ⇔ CSV (Export+Import)
plugins.description: HighlightsExport text strings to CSV for bulk editingExport text strings to CSV and share with developers/translators/copy writers/reviewersImport edited CSV back to Figma to update variablesMulti-lingual support built-inSimple CSV formatSupports only string variablesNon English variable valuesThe CSV from the plugin is encoded with UTF-8 encoding, which can handle most languages written in Unicode.Some programs, particularly MS Excel, might not open/save the CSV properly when opened normally/directly. Follow below steps if you face issues.Opening the CSVFor MS Excel: Open a new excel file > Click Data > Get External Data > From text > Select the CSV file > Set file origin to UTF-8 in the wizard.For other programs, follow similar methods to set the file encoding to UTF-8 before opening the CSV.Saving the CSV after editingFor MS Excel: File > Save as > Change file format in the dropdown to "CSV UTF-8 (Comma delimited) (.csv)" > SaveFor other programs, follow similar methods to set the file encoding to UTF-8 before saving the edited CSV.

plugins.name: Guides inspector
plugins.description:
The Guides inspector is complete control over the guides!

✅ You can:
- Create / Delete guides.
- Copy / Paste guides of the frame.
- Generate grids from guides.
- Create guide templates for later use.
- Adjust the position of the guides with high accuracy.

⚠ Changes on the canvas are sometimes displayed only after you hover over it. This bug should be fixed soon.

About the Create Guides window:
⚠ To get into it, you need to click on the name of the frame.

1. The Margin parameter is specified in the following order: margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, margin-left.

2. Some parameters support the "auto" value. 

It can be used, for example, to center the columns by setting the margin-left and margin-right parameters to "auto".
If you specify it only for margin-left, and margin-right set to 0, then the columns will be pressed to the right edge.

⚠ When applying the template, - if its parameters are not suitable for the selected frame, - they will be adjusted.

For example, if the template contains 10 columns with a width of 100px, and the frame has a width of only 500px, then the number of columns will be reduced to 5.

___
A demo video with an example of usage can be found here: producthunt.com/posts/guides-inspector-figma-plugin

accepted.name: Andreslav Kozlov
accepted.description: Digital designer. I love the design, the code and the cock crow in the morning :) Freelancer.

For example, if the template contains 10 columns with a width of 100px, and the frame has a width of only 500px, then the number of columns will be reduced to 5.

___
A demo video with an example of usage can be found here: producthunt.com/posts/guides-inspector-figma-plugin

plugins.name: Figma to React Bootstrap
plugins.description: Website:https://figma-to-react-bootstrap.vercel.app/How to use this plugin?:How to use: Figma to React Bootstrap PluginFigma to React BootstrapThis cool plugin takes your figma designs that uses the Figma components from Figma to React Bootstrap file and turns them into ready-to-use React-Bootstrap components. It's like having a design wizard by your side, so you can spend more time building your layouts. The preview mode offers an awesome user experiences that shows in real time the rendered react component.Figma to React Bootstrap Figma Component libraryThis component file library has been especially made to follow the React Bootstrap components API to match it's component's props, making it easier to use out of the box instances to use in your designs.ProTip!: As long as your layers are named after React Bootstrap components and follow the same nested components structure, then the plugin will render the React Bootstrap component﻿Supported components:✅ Grid❌Forms✅ Accordion✅ Alerts✅ Badge✅ Breadcrumb✅ Button group✅ Buttons✅ Card✅ Carousels✅ Close button✅ Dropdowns✅ Figures❌ Images✅ Figures✅ List groups✅ Modal✅ Navbars✅ Navs and tabs❌ Offcanvas❌ Overlay✅ Pagination❌ Placeholders❌ Progress bars (in progress)✅ Spinners✅ Tables❌ Tabs✅ Toast (and Toast container)*This plugin does not export your custom styles yet* This plugin is meant to render default styled React Bootstrap components.* Maybe in the future I will implement custom styling export.If you want to support my work in other ways:☕️ Buy me a coffeeThank you!

plugins.name: Figma to Readymag
plugins.description: Speed-transfer your layouts to ReadymagThe Figma to Readymag plugin imports a page layout or its separate elements into a Readymag project. It saves you time and effort when moving anything created in Figma into Readymag. The plugin doesn’t create the ready-to-go website but only transfers the composition so you can elaborate it further.How to use the pluginOpen the plugin in your Figma project.Select any number of elements or a single-page layout. Click “Prepare for copying” and wait for the process to finish. It may take a few seconds.Then, click the “Copy to clipboard” button. Wait a bit until your elements or a layout is copied.Go to your Readymag project and paste the content. If you want to paste one or several copied elements, press ⌘/Ctrl+V. If you’ve copied the Full page layout and want your Readymag page parameters to adapt to your Figma ones, press ⌘/Ctrl+Shift+V.Wait until the pasting is finished.Note: The plugin moves Figma elements to Readymag’s Editor using just three widgets: Text, Shape, and Picture. Such functionality saves elements’ visual characteristics but doesn’t add interactivity to them—you’ll need to manually add interactive features, such as links, buttons, and animations afterward.We made sure to pick the most corresponding substitutes for the unique Figma elements: in cases where some technical abilities in Figma and Readymag don’t match, you’ll get the option closest to your initial idea.Workflow tipsHere are a few tips that’ll help you use the plugin with maximum vantage:To get everything imported smoothly, make sure your Readymag project has the fonts used in the Figma layout. You can add fonts to a project from Readymag’s font library or upload fonts that aren’t in the library directly in the project.Transfer to the desktop version of your project. Readymag follows desktop-first logic, which means that the desktop version is the primary one and the mobile version is created from the desktop one. You can paste your elements into the mobile version, but they’ll be hidden by default on the desktop one.Make sure each of your elements is within 9999px in width and height. The plugin can only transfer elements in this range. If a Figma element is bigger, it won’t appear in your Readymag layout.Use it to import graphics. The plugin makes it easy to import graphic elements, such as icons, directly and in 2 clicks.What Readymag isIt’s a design tool that helps create interactive websites, editorials, portfolios, and landing pages without coding. It offers advanced animations, a massive library of free fonts, and teamwork features, and empowers everyone to meet their goals for online representation while maintaining complete creative freedom.

plugins.tagline: Move layouts and elements to Readymag in 3 clicks

plugins.name: JavaScript and JSX Serializer
plugins.description: With plugins and widgets it's possible to build powerful Figma tools, but it's still easier to build the components you need in Figma itself. This tool serializes Figma nodes to JavaScript, TypeScript, and JSX that can be copied and pasted into your plugin or widget code. It's basically what should show up in the code dropdown under the inspect tab.

plugins.name: Frame History
plugins.description: The fastest way to archive your work and look back at previous iterations. No more manual hassle - get rid of the copy/paste and duplicate pages process. ✅ Save copies of frames you're working on, in a single click.✅ Explore a visual chronological timeline of your saved frames.✅ Navigate faster with a time saving version preview.✅ Easily search and browse through saved frames.⚙️ How it worksSelect the frame you want to save and click the Save button. Frame History will send a copy of the frame to a page called “Frame History” that keeps a visual chronological timeline of your saved versions.Every time you save a version, Frame History will automatically add a version preview to the plugin’s UI. Version previews are only visible to the creator, and are easy to find using the search feature.⭐ Help us improveFeedback and questions are welcome: colorocket.contact@gmail.com🚀 RoadmapFrame History is currently in beta. We are planning to add more cool features to make it even better! User requests:Detach all instances when savingSave multiple frames at onceResize plugin window
